Case Study: Single cell transcriptomics of human epidermis identifies basal stem cell transition states

Kayla Interdonanto

Roswell Park Comprehensive Cancer Center
Kayla.Morrell@RoswellPark.org

2 November 2022

Source: vignettes/hca-66d7d92a-d6c5-492c-815b-f81c7c93c984.Rmd
hca-66d7d92a-d6c5-492c-815b-f81c7c93c984.Rmd

Setup

Load useful packages

library(HCACaseStudies)
library(hca)
library(dplyr)
library(tidyr)

Project information

Set the project id

project_id <- "66d7d92a-d6c5-492c-815b-f81c7c93c984"

Display information about the project

project_information(project_id)
## Title
##   Single cell transcriptomics of human epidermis identifies basal stem
##   cell transition states
## Contributors (unknown order; any role)
##   Guadalupe Gutierrez, Ami Day, Shuxiong Wang, Michael,L,Drummond,
##   Adam,R,Stabell, Eric Tarapore, Christian,F,Guerrero-Juarez,
##   Claudia,A,Benavente, Qing Nie, Adam,L,MacLean, Scott X Atwood,
##   Bao,T,That, Stephanie,C,Wu
## Description
##   How stem cells give rise to epidermis is unclear despite the crucial
##   role the epidermis plays in barrier and appendage formation. Here we
##   use single cell-RNA sequencing to interrogate basal stem cell
##   heterogeneity of human interfollicular epidermis and find four
##   spatially distinct stem cell populations at the top and bottom of
##   rete ridges and transitional positions between the basal and
##   suprabasal epidermal layers. Cell-cell communication modeling
##   suggests that basal cell populations serve as crucial signaling hubs
##   to maintain epidermal communication. Combining pseudotime, RNA
##   velocity, and cellular entropy analyses point to a hierarchical
##   differentiation lineage supporting multi-stem cell interfollicular
##   epidermal homeostasis models and suggest that transitional basal stem
##   cells are stable states essential for proper stratification. Finally,
##   alterations in differentially expressed transitional basal stem cell
##   genes result in severe thinning of human skin equivalents, validating
##   their essential role in epidermal homeostasis and reinforcing the
##   critical nature of basal stem cell heterogeneity.
## DOI
##   10.1038/s41467-020-18075-7
## URL
##   https://www.nature.com/articles/s41467-020-18075-7#Sec10
## Project
##   https://data.humancellatlas.org/explore/projects/66d7d92a-d6c5-492c-815b-f81c7c93c984

Conventions

Statistics calculated locally use local.* for column names, e.g., local.cellCount.

Data processing

Project & samples

Create a filter to identify the project

project_filter <- filters(projectId = list(is = project_id))

Find the project

p <- projects(project_filter, as = "tibble_expanded")
p |> glimpse()

Samples associated with the project

s <- samples(project_filter, as = "tibble_expanded")

Columns are either variable and therefore describe sample-level information…

## informative 'specimen' or 'donorOrganisms' columns
s |>
    select(starts_with("specimens") | starts_with("donorOrganisms")) |>
    select(where(column_is_informative)) |>
    glimpse()
## Rows: 5
## Columns: 2
## $ specimens.id      <chr> "GSM4431902", "GSM4431901", "GSM4431903", "GSM443190…
## $ donorOrganisms.id <chr> "Donor2", "Donor1", "Donor3", "Donor5", "Donor4"

…or invariant and reflect experiment-wide annotation

s |>
    select(where(column_is_experimentwide)) |>
    distinct() |>
    glimpse()

Data files

What types of files does the project have?

files1 <- files(project_filter)

files1 |>
    glimpse()
## Rows: 29
## Columns: 8

files1 |>
    count(fileFormat)
## # A tibble: 3 × 2
##   fileFormat     n
##   <chr>      <int>
## 1 fastq.gz      14
## 2 mtx.gz         5
## 3 tsv.gz        10

## create `files2` with just the files needed for count-matrix
## analysis

files2 <- files1 |> filter(fileFormat != "fastq.gz")

Retrieve and cache locally all files needed to construct a gene x cell count matrix.

tar_files <-
    files2 |>
    files_download() |>
    setNames(files2 |> pull(name))

Parse the file names to create a tibble with local file path, file type, and sample id.

tar_files_names <- files2 |> pull(name)

local_files <- 
    tibble(
        local.filePath = file.path(tar_files),
        local.fileType = sub(".*_([[:alpha:]]*).*", "\\1Path", tar_files_names),
        local.sampleId = sub("([^_]*).*", "\\1", tar_files_names)
    ) |>
    pivot_wider(
        names_from = local.fileType,
        names_prefix = "local.",
        values_from = "local.filePath"
    )

local_files |>
    mutate(across(ends_with("Path"), basename))
## # A tibble: 5 × 4
##   local.sampleId local.genesPath              local.matrixPath           local…¹
##   <chr>          <chr>                        <chr>                      <chr>  
## 1 GSM4431904     5fbc3974fa26_5fbc3974fa26.gz 5fbc4ddaef89_5fbc4ddaef89… 5fbc60…
## 2 GSM4431905     5fbc2ed2f242_5fbc2ed2f242.gz 5fbc641aa757_5fbc641aa757… 5fbc6d…
## 3 GSM4431902     5fbc1b1ee312_5fbc1b1ee312.gz 5fbc3c2435cc_5fbc3c2435cc… 5fbc71…
## 4 GSM4431903     5fbc8cdc0a7_5fbc8cdc0a7.gz   5fbc12b80c01_5fbc12b80c01… 5fbc11…
## 5 GSM4431901     5fbc26e61e7a_5fbc26e61e7a.gz 5fbc7c231874_5fbc7c231874… 5fbc6d…
## # … with abbreviated variable name ¹​local.barcodesPath

Extract some data from the files, e.g., cell and gene counts.

gene_and_cell_counts <-
    local_files |>
    csv_tsv_count_lines("local.sampleId", "local.barcodesPath") |>
    rename(local.cellCount = local.lines) |>
    csv_tsv_count_lines("local.sampleId", "local.genesPath") |>
    rename(local.geneCount = local.lines)
gene_and_cell_counts |>
    select(local.sampleId, local.geneCount, local.cellCount)
## # A tibble: 5 × 3
##   local.sampleId local.geneCount local.cellCount
##   <chr>                    <int>           <int>
## 1 GSM4431904               33694            7667
## 2 GSM4431905               33694            1709
## 3 GSM4431902               33694            1346
## 4 GSM4431903               33694            4728
## 5 GSM4431901               33694            2103
object_name <- "local.countMatrix"
if (!cache_exists(project_id, object_name)) {
    local_files |>
        mtx_count_matrix(
            "local.matrixPath", "local.genesPath", "local.barcodesPath"
        ) |>
        cache_add(project_id, object_name)
}

count_matrix <- cache_read(project_id, object_name)

class(count_matrix)[1]
## [1] "dgCMatrix"
dim(count_matrix)
## [1] 33694 17553
format(object.size(count_matrix), units = "auto")
## [1] "477.3 Mb"

Row, sample, and cell annotations

Row (gene) data

row_data <-
    local_files |>
    slice(1) |>
    pull("local.genesPath") |>
    readr::read_tsv(
        col_names = c("ensembl_id", "hugo_symbol"),
        show_col_types = FALSE
    )

row_data
## # A tibble: 33,694 × 2
##    ensembl_id      hugo_symbol

Column (sample & cell) data

sample_data <-
    ## from the hca sample annotation...
    s |>
    select(
        where(column_is_informative) & where(is.atomic)
    ) |>
    left_join(
        gene_and_cell_counts |>
        select(local.sampleId, local.cellCount, local.geneCount),
        by = c(samples.id = "local.sampleId")
    )

sample_data
## # A tibble: 5 × 10
##   entryId        dates…¹ dates…² dates…³ donor…⁴ fileT…⁵ sampl…⁶ speci…⁷ local…⁸
##   <chr>          <chr>   <chr>   <chr>   <chr>     <int> <chr>   <chr>     <int>
## 1 55d3a921-7d7b… 2022-0… 2022-0… 2022-0… Donor2     1346 GSM443… GSM443…    1346
## 2 59ea746b-4f44… 2022-0… 2022-0… 2022-0… Donor1     2103 GSM443… GSM443…    2103
## 3 8da21f01-5af2… 2022-0… 2022-0… 2022-0… Donor3     4728 GSM443… GSM443…    4728
## 4 976281e4-3d56… 2022-0… 2022-0… 2022-0… Donor5     1709 GSM443… GSM443…    1709
## 5 ce411b44-5734… 2022-0… 2022-0… 2022-0… Donor4     7667 GSM443… GSM443…    7667
## # … with 1 more variable: local.geneCount <int>, and abbreviated variable names
## #   ¹​dates.lastModifiedDate, ²​dates.submissionDate, ³​dates.updateDate,
## #   ⁴​donorOrganisms.id, ⁵​fileTypeSummaries.matrixCellCount, ⁶​samples.id,
## #   ⁷​specimens.id, ⁸​local.cellCount
cell_barcodes <- 
    local_files |>
    pull("local.barcodesPath") |>
    lapply(readLines)

sampleId <- pull(local_files, "local.sampleId")
cell_data <- tibble(
    local.sampleId = rep(sampleId, lengths(cell_barcodes)),
    local.barcodes = unlist(cell_barcodes, use.names = FALSE)
)

cell_data
## # A tibble: 17,553 × 2
##    local.sampleId local.barcodes    
##    <chr>          <chr>             
##  1 GSM4431904     AAACCTGAGGTGTTAA-1
##  2 GSM4431904     AAACCTGAGTGCGATG-1

## N.B. some barcodes are duplicated 2 times
cell_data |>
    count(local.barcodes, sort = TRUE, name = "occurrences") |>
    count(occurrences, name = "n_barcodes")
## # A tibble: 2 × 2

##         <int>      <int>
## 1           1      17279
## 2           2        137

Experiment-wide metadata 

sample_metadata <-
    s |>
    select(where(column_is_experimentwide) & !any_of(names(p))) |>
    distinct()

metadata <- bind_cols(p, sample_metadata)

metadata |>
    glimpse()
